items.sentence: It\'s been a while since I\'ve talked to Tom.
The vending machine is making strange noises.
We don\'t know whether to believe Tom or not.
Let\'s forget about what happened last night.
Let\'s put off the meeting until next Friday.
Have you ever dealt with a problem like this?
I was pretty tired when I got home from work.
I was probably thirty years old at that time.
I was the one who introduced Tom to his wife.
I was thinking about our first day in Boston.
I was told that you might be able to help me.
Tom invited Mary and her sister to his party.
You made the mistake on purpose, didn\'t you?
Both French and English are spoken in Canada.
Can you do me a favor and take Tom to school?
I\'ll do it the way you\'ve told me to do it.
I\'m afraid I wouldn\'t be very good company.
Tom should\'ve gone to the dentist yesterday.
Why don\'t you just admit that you\'re wrong?
Why don\'t you try it? Maybe you\'ll like it.
